intro: Omphalocarpum cabrae, commonly known as the desert brome, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, fibrous root system. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Omphalocarpum cabrae plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
